meanings.definition: A group or set of twenty.
meanings.sent1: I need a score of pencils for the class.
meanings.sent2: The baseball team had a score of runs in the game.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally bought a score of bananas, thinking they were singles.
meanings.sent4: The field was covered with a score of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The farmer harvested a score of ripe pumpkins from the field.

meanings.definition: A notch or mark made in keeping an account.
meanings.sent1: He kept a score on the wall to track his progress.
meanings.sent2: The score on the paper showed the total number of points earned.
meanings.sent3: I found a mysterious score on the old tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins had a score carved into the stone.
meanings.sent5: The detective discovered a hidden score in the suspect's notebook.

meanings.definition: The act of obtaining a point in a game or contest.
meanings.sent1: Scoring a goal in soccer earns the team a point.
meanings.sent2: The basketball player made a score from the free-throw line.
meanings.sent3: The cat made a score by catching the mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking was a score in the trivia competition.
meanings.sent5: The final score of the match determined the winner.

meanings.sent1: She hoped to score a high grade on the test.
meanings.sent2: The team worked hard to score a victory in the championship.
meanings.sent3: I managed to score a discount on the new phone.
meanings.sent4: He scored a job at the new company.
meanings.sent5: The artist scored a big commission for a mural.

meanings.definition: To make a written mark on.
meanings.sent1: Please score your answers with a pencil.
meanings.sent2: The artist scored intricate patterns on the pottery.
meanings.sent3: I will score a reminder on the calendar.
meanings.sent4: She scored her name on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter scored lines on the wood for cutting.
